data.job_description:
In a world where trades are happening faster than ever to answer our needs, where sustainability is not just an option anymore, clarity and trust in the information we trade with are a must.

So, say hello to Kpler! We exist to facilitate sustainable and efficient trade to meet the changing needs of our world. To do so we've built a Data-as-a-Service solution that does exactly that across the lifecycle of a trade.

Our solution aggregates data from hundreds of sources including radar and satellite imagery as well as logistics, governmental, shipping databases and more. Intelligently connecting the dots across fragmented information landscapes, we bring to our clients a unique, real-time understanding of the trades happening all over the world, by giving them access to live information about the movement of cargos, the availability of vessels as well as commodity storage.

To support this endeavor, we have teams in more than 7 countries and 9 key locations (Brussels, Paris, Hyères, London, Vienna, Dubai, Singapore, Houston and New York). With individuals of various backgrounds, diverse skills, and international experiences, being global & inclusive is in our DNA!

What is the job?

Kpler’s market data analyst team behind our industry-leading Crude Oil platform is looking for an experienced candidate to help support and further develop our constantly evolving product that spans a wide range of market data including cargo-tracking, inventories, freight, supply & demand, and refineries.

The role will involve daily checking, structuring, and analysis of cargo-level data. You will be required to follow the main events occurring in the crude oil market, track specific trends impacting global trade flows, and build a network of contacts in the industry. Your objective will be to monitor the Kpler platform and constantly ensure the highest level of accuracy and timeliness of our data, with more focus on the Americas region. You will also be expected to regularly interact with our clients to help them extract as much value from our systems as possible.

This role is open to locations: New York AND Houston.

In addition, you will be working on various projects to develop new features or improve Kpler data quality.

This will include day-to-day collaboration with teammates from various global offices and teams.

● Regular research and tracking of oil market news on both macro and granular levels.

● Daily checks of Kpler data to ensure reliability and accuracy of services provided.

● Extracting meaningful patterns and detecting trend disruption.

● Drafting fast responses to ad-hoc requests from our users.

● Maintaining and expanding a comprehensive dataset related to the oil market.

● Regular participation in client meetings to discuss market- and data-related topics.

● Participate in long-term projects, and collaborate with global colleagues from various teams to deliver market insights, product enhancements and new features.

Daily checks of Kpler data to ensure reliability and accuracy of data and services providedMaintain ownership of crude oil data for the whole fleet of Kpler products, from cargo flows to inventoriesExtract meaningful patterns and detect new market trends, both micro and macro levelDraft fast-response analysis to ad-hoc requests from clients and real-time market eventsPerform specific, in-depth analyses to continuously improve our product and data quality Attend regular meetings with engineering and product teams to discuss data related topics Attend regular meetings with commercial teams to support with client relations and development.

This role will be based in the United States and report to the Market Data Manager – Crude Oil.

It could be the perfect fit if you...

● have a graduate degree in Economics, Finance, International Trade or Engineering related fields with at least 3 years of experience as an analyst (or a similar role) covering the crude oil market (experience working with the broader petroleum commodities market/industry is also considered).

● are a highly motivated individual, a self-starter who will be passionate about owning responsibilities upholding the trusted accuracy and agility of the Kpler crude oil data.

● have advanced Excel skills and some understanding of SQL (other languages such as Python or VBA is a plus).

● demonstrate strong capabilities in logical thinking with attention to detail.

● have experience working with large, disparate and/or unstructured data sets.

● possess excellent analytical ability, at ease with working with database and able to highlight trends and use complex data to support decisions.

● are an effective team player, quick learner and able to cope with short deadlines across different simultaneous projects with minimal supervision.

#LI-Remote

Our values

• Be humble - We always place the interests of the collective before your own.

• Respect and care for others - We make every person feel comfortable in their own beliefs, decisions, and perspectives.

• Take responsibility - We take ownership of our actions.

• Act with integrity -We are honest and transparent in all your dealings.

• Be bold - We push the boundaries in order to improve and grow.

You’ll get to work in a truly global environment, with more than 30 nationalities speaking more than 15 languages.

Our People Pledge

Don’t meet every single requirement? Research shows that women and people of color are less likely than others to apply if they feel like they don’t match 100% of the job requirements. Don’t let the confidence gap stand in your way, we’d love to hear from you! We understand that experience comes in many different forms and are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

Kpler is committed to providing a fair, inclusive and diverse work-environment. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global community. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer.

By applying, I confirm that I have read and accept the Staff Privacy Notice

Our client, a Fortune 1000 financial services company is looking for Business Data Analysts.
Business Data Analysts are responsible for coordinating with internal stakeholders and partners for platform updates and installation of services for retirement plan clients. This is a 2 year contract role. This is a hybrid role so candidates should live in the areas of Charlotte, Denver or Dallas. You can come onboard as our W2 or Independent Contractor. Business Data Analysts partner with external vendors and internal partners to obtain all necessary data for each transition. They are responsible to ensure all plan data is ultimately comprehensive, inclusive, and accurate to ensure the enterprise's clients and transitions are successful. Key Responsibilities and Duties
• Successfully implement projects for institutional retirement plans with high quality data outcomes
• Offer consultative data solutions for plan administration challenges
• Escalate risks and issues for retirement plan implementations in a timely manner.
• Engage with appropriate resources in a highly-matrixed environment to resolve data issues including client, plan management services and IT. Other Skills:
• Strong analytical and Excel skills. Excel test part of interview.
• Excellent verbal and written skills Educational Requirements

• 3+ Years Required; 5+ Years Preferred
• Solid experience as a Business Data Analyst, End User Computing Analyst or operations analyst

• Financial services experience is a big plus
• Agile experience is nice to have FINRA Registrations
• Series 6 or 7

Current Employees:

If you are a current employee at Ryder (not a Contractor or temporary employee through a staffing agency), please click here (http://wd5.myworkday.com/ryder/d/task/1422$3.htmld) to log in to Workday to apply using the internal application process.

(https://ryder.com/job-applicant-privacy-policy)\

You are the driving force behind our company.

Start your career with Ryder today!

Summary

The Fleet Management Solutions Financial Data Analytics team is responsible for data mining, financial analysis, and reporting on the 150,000 vehicles owned by Ryder and determining optimal asset management strategies to maximize profitability. The team also works with Operations leadership to implement solutions and calculate the financial improvement that results from those actions. Our Financial Data Analytics team operates in a fast paced environment where we are challenged to utilize the cutting edge analytics & machine learning techniques to build predictive models and promote data driven decision making throughout the organization.
• REMOTE work from HOME*

Essential Functions
• Have the intellectual curiosity to actively seek out new areas of potential improvement and drill into the details to find the root cause of problems. This requires a willingness to question assumptions and an internal drive for continuous improvement.
• Build ML models to predict future cash flows resulting from new asset management policies and strategies.
• Work with business partners to identify cost savings opportunities, model how potential actions would impact the P&L, identify risks to the plan, create reporting to measure progress, and report savings results to senior leadership.
• Mine data in SQL to discover trends and changes in profitability, determine cause-and-effect relationships, and then advise business partners on potential actions to improve results.
• Create automated reporting in Power BI to communicate performance metrics and highlight areas of potential improvement to operations management.
• Take ownership of the data and work to ensure that data is as complete and accurate as possible. This requires working with Operations to understand the business processes behind the data and with IT to understand how the data is processed and stored.

Additional Responsibilities
• Performs other duties as assigned.

Skills and Abilities
• Key tools include Excel, SQL, and Power BI
• Working knowledge in SQL, R, Python, or other scripting languages
• Experience building ML models and applying them to business cases
• Advanced knowledge of financial modeling and how business actions impact financial statements
• Must have a proven ability to drive business results with their databased insights
• Have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes
• Ability to arrive at and give recommendations to senior management based on available information
• Strong written and verbal communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, Math or related
• Master's degree preferred
• Four (4) years or more relevant experience
• Four (4) years or more experience in Corporate Finance, Applied Statistical Analysis or Transportation Industrial Engineering preferred

Applicants from California, Colorado, Connecticut, New York City & Washington:

Salary is determined based on internal equity; internal salary ranges; market

data/ranges; applicant’s skills; prior relevant experience; certain degrees or

certifications, etc.

The salary for this position ranges from $70K to $95K.

Salaries may be supplemented with a bonus as applicable and/or as business conditions allow.

Ryder offers comprehensive health and welfare benefits, to include medical,

prescription, dental, vision, life insurance and disability insurance options, as well as paid time off for vacation, illness, bereavement, family and parental leave, and a tax advantaged 401(k) retirement savings plan.

Job Category: Financial Analysis

Ryder is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

(https://ryder.com/job-applicant-privacy-policy)\

Description

Providence St. Joseph Health is calling a Senior Business Data Analyst, Revenue Cycle to work remotely within our footprint states: AK, CA, MT, OR, TX and/or WA.

The Sr. Business Data Analyst supports Enterprise Revenue Cycle goals by conducting analytics-oriented projects. The Sr Business Data Analyst pursues the answering of "why" questions, provides advisory services to stakeholders and assists customers through interpretation of information. A genuine curiosity of data drives the Business Analyst Sr to seek insights, threats and opportunities for Enterprise Revenue Cycle and Finance.

The Sr Business Data Analyst will excel in the key components of the analytics project lifecycle including intake management, requirements gathering, data querying, data manipulation & analysis, validation, effectively communicating findings and documentation. Similarly, the role requires the effective management of concurrent work items, escalating blocks when appropriate and meeting targeted delivery dates. Contributions to overall deliverable integrity will be promoted through Quality Assurance of other Analysts' work. Deliverables will range from small, targeted ad-hoc analyses to large scale projects. The Data Analyst Sr may be expected to serve as an accountable lead on projects. Assignments will include serving as a representative of the Data & Insights team at meetings, workgroups, etc. For individual, and overall team success the role requires a high degree of interaction with other RC Data & Insights practice areas. Opportunities for self-directed research will allow the Business Analyst Sr to pursue new avenues of data exploration. While Revenue Cycle data is the core of most analyses, this role requires the ability to leverage many other data areas (Finance, clinical, etc.) and data types (database, files, non-standard, etc.).

The objective for this role is to provide data analysis and advisory services to Data & Advisory customers. The scope of work may span the entire organization with a strong focus on Revenue Cycle and Finance. A significant portion of the work portfolio involves answering "why questions". Our customers expect our team to help them gain understanding of reports and metrics and specifically, unexplainable behavior in those data. To do this, the Business Analyst Sr will employ analytics techniques to understand the problem, leverage appropriate data, discover causality, and effectively communicate to the customer. Other portfolio efforts include advising stakeholders on potential actions based on analyses and involve assisting customers through interpretive/guidance of D&I products.

At the middle of the range, this role requires strong knowledge of revenue cycle, healthcare and finance data, and a working knowledge of at least three RC functions. The Business Analyst Sr must possess the technical skills to interact with, and draw data from, source systems, data warehouses, etc. The analyst is proficient with reporting software and can easily express visualizations in Tableau or Power BI. At this level, there is an expectation that findings and recommendations can be created in suitable platforms and effectively delivered to audiences at all levels of the organization. All elements of the analytics lifecycle are understood and practiced. Deliverables are appropriately documented and archived for potential recovery/re-use. May be asked to partner with consultants on targeted projects. The Business Analyst Sr cultivates relationships with key business-based resources, customers and stakeholders. The Business Analyst Sr is assigned the more difficult and complex deliverables in the team's portfolio and often mentors analytics Business Analysts.

The Business Analyst Sr can describe complex data to non-technical colleagues, and works independently, in an organized, self-directed, efficient manner to deliver multiple competing priorities. The ability to effectively and graphically communicate complex data to both individuals and groups is required.

The Business Analyst Sr performs all duties in a manner which promotes teamwork and reflects the mission and philosophy of Providence St Joseph Health.
• Fulfill requests to the Analytics and Advisory team by clarifying requirements, drawing data, developing findings, communicating results, and documenting deliverables.
• Excels in the key components of the analytics project lifecycle.
• Assists customers through interpretation of reports, data, etc.
• Advises stakeholders on potential action items based on analytics findings.
• Provides QA on team member’s products.
• Collaborates with other Data & Insights teams, both gaining/providing support, information, etc.

Required qualifications:
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer science, mathematics, statistics, information technology, health informatics, public health, or related subject or equivalent educ, experience
• 5 years strong SQL programming skills. Some combination of experience with: Snowflake, SQL Server, Oracle SQL or similar platforms
• 5 years progressive experience in practicing analytics as a data analyst, report analyst, business analyst, BI developer, etc.
• 2 years experience with two or more provider-based Revenue Cycle vert
• 3 years proven experience creating, managing, and validating large data sets
• Demonstrated PC skills, i.e. proficient with MS Office products including Word, Excel, Teams, SharePoint, Power Point and Outlook

Preferred qualifications:
• Master's Degree in Computer science, mathematics, statistics, information technology, health informatics, public health, or related subject
• Experience with EPIC: reporting data out of Epic, reviewing Revenue Cycle related account detail
• Report writing skills in Tableau or Power BI

About the department you will serve.

One Revenue Cycle (ORC) is the name adopted to reflect the Providence employees who work throughout Providence Health & Services (PH&S) in revenue cycle systems and structures in support of our ministries and operations in all regions from Alaska to California. ORC’s objective is to ensure our core strategy, One Ministry Committed to Excellence, is delivered along with the enhanced overall patient care experience (know me, care for me, ease my way) by providing a robust foundation of services, operational and technical support, and the sharing of comprehensive, relevant, and highly specialized revenue cycle expertise.

We offer a full comprehensive range of benefits — see our website for details — http://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits
About Providence

At Providence, our strength lies in Our Promise of “Know me, care for me, ease my way.” Working at our family of organizations means that regardless of your role, we’ll walk alongside you in your career, supporting you so you can support others. We provide best-in-class benefits and we foster an inclusive workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone is essential, heard and respected. Together, our 120,000 caregivers (all employees) serve in over 50 hospitals, over 1,000 clinics and a full range of health and social services across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. As a comprehensive health care organization, we are serving more people, advancing best practices and continuing our more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable.

data.job_description:
Before we dive into the role, let’s talk about flexibility. At Zip, our office is in New York City but we can hire from anywhere across the United States. Our Zipsters can choose where and when they work by taking full advantage of our hybrid-work environment.

So whether you’re fully remote, mostly in the office or a mix of the two, you’ll be empowered to do whatever brings out your best.

About us

We are Zip, a global Buy Now, Pay Later company providing fair and seamless solutions that simplify how millions of people pay. Our journey began in Australia, has taken us to multiple different markets and we’re just getting started.

We exist to create a world where people can live fearlessly today, knowing they’re in control of tomorrow. Focused on product innovation that puts people at the centre, we put the financial well-being of our customers and merchant partners at the heart of everything that we do.

About the role

We’re looking for a data fanatic to join a team of analysts that are responsible for building Zip’s data platforms. We need people who understand data at a granular level – they don’t rely on any one tool but rather understand them all, and each of their pros and cons. This is a unique opportunity to build the data strategy and architecture at a data-driven startup that’s changing the world of finance, shoulder-to-shoulder with a tight team that has your back.

What you’ll do
• Be responsible for Zip’s data analytics platforms across key departments with a dominant focus on marketing.
• Partner closely with business leaders to create and enable analytics around how Zip attracts, engages and retains customers in our App.
• Build and maintain data analytics dashboards and other tools (alation, tableau, amplitude, optimizely).
• Identify opportunities in the business operations for data-based recommendations.
• Bring a strong track record of analytics enablement to companies with a focus on fintech.
• Connect vague business questions to data projects to create new analytics capabilities; this will require strong SQL knowledge, data modeling experience is a plus.
• Work with our complex and large volume of data to understand trends, behaviors and opportunities for revenue growth.
• Communicate insights with senior stakeholders and team members.
• Conduct pre and post implementation reviews and present compelling campaign results and actionable insights.
• Promote a high standard of campaign and customer analytics within Marketing to drive successful program outcomes using data led insights.
• Collaborate with the broader Data & Risk Team to share ideas and discuss analytical approaches in the interests of promoting continual development.

What you’ll bring
• 2-4 years of professional, full-time data experience, this includes experience with a coding language, SQL preferred, data modeling, and a BI tool, tableau preferred.
• An excellent addition to our culture: You believe and want to participate in a blameless culture which focuses on process and technology. You feel accountable for everything you do and that sense of urgency has been driving you your entire life. You like to have a good time while getting things done. When we say a “team player” we mean it - you have a crisp high-five and funny stories to tell. You have your team’s back, and the team has yours.
• A yearning to learn new things: You know that there’s always more to learn, and it bothers you that there isn’t enough time in the day to learn about the next topic. You’re up-to-date on new trends in data – you know who’s using what to solve various problems and are excited for the next release of your favorite tool. If you can handle being thrown in the deep end of the pool, this team’s for you.
• The ability to solve big picture problems: Proactively identify reports, dashboards, and analysis needed by the business. Partner with Product & Engineering teams to strategize and drive user growth.
• Comfort in uncertainty: You’re comfortable in the weeds pulling, cleaning, analyzing, and transforming raw data into insightful, viz-ual findings. You conduct the necessary research when presented with open ended questions. Critical and open-ended thinking are second nature.
• The drive to seek answers in data: You are comfortable analyzing millions of transactional data points. You use data to drive decision-making and make recommendations on how to best grow the business. You work closely with leadership to identify, measure, and grow major KPIs across business lines.
• A passion for analytics: You excitedly seek opportunities to leverage Tableau. Advanced SQL is in your toolkit to solve complex business problems. You know modeling techniques and love to partner with Data Engineers. When faced with technical challenges, you take the initiative to learn new approaches.

Pay Range: $87,000 - $130,000

The Pay Range for this position: Minimum - Maximum is based on the industry benchmark for the position, function, level and Zip's compensation strategies. However, actual base salary will depend on varying factors, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. If hired, employee will be in an 'at-will position' and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payments, compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

#LI-REMOTE

We’re proud to be a values-led business. They guide us in everything we do - how we work together and create game-changing experiences for our customers and fellow Zipsters.

If you only meet some of the requirements for this role, that's okay. We value a diverse range of backgrounds and ideas and believe this is fundamental for our future success. So, if you have the curiosity to learn and the willingness to teach what you know, we'd love to hear from you.

We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of their age, cultural background, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, or anything else.

What’s in it for you?

We offer a variety of perks and benefits to support you at both work and home. Here’s a taste of what you can expect!

● Flexible working culture

● Share incentive programs

● 20 days PTO every year

● Generous paid parental leave

● Leading family support policies

● 100% employer covered insurance

● Beautiful Midtown office with a casual dress code

● Learning and wellness subscription stipend

● Company-sponsored 401k match

● Remote First Friendly!

We want to make sure our recruitment processes are accessible and inclusive for all people. If there's any adjustments that need to be made to ensure you have a fair and equal experience in our recruitment process please let your Talent Acquisition Partner know. We are also a proud 2023 Circle Back initiative employer and commit to respond to every applicant.

Join us on our mission to be the first payment choice, everywhere and every day.

data.job_description:
Minimum qualifications:
• Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Bioinformatics, Economics, etc.) or equivalent practical experience
• 2 years of experience in a data science related field
• Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python, MATLAB) and database languages (i.e. SQL)
• Experience leveraging data insights into storytelling for business stakeholders

Preferred qualifications:
• PhD in Statistics or a related quantitative discipline
• 2 years of experience with statistical data analysis such as generalized linear models, multivariate analysis, clustering/segmentation, and sampling methods
• Experience in controlled experiment design and causal inference methods
• Experience with machine learning on large-scale computing systems like Hadoop, MapReduce, or similar environments
• Ability to prioritize requests and partner well in an environment with competing demands from stakeholders
• Excellent communication skills

About the job

Google Ads Marketing aims to help advertisers of all sizes succeed with digital marketing. In this role, you will work with a team to advance the science of Marketing to customers that use Google’s advertising solutions. This is a unique opportunity to apply the tools of Data Science to accelerate Ads business growth, working cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, and Product teams.

You will perform data analytics, drive initiatives in experimentation, measurement, and advance machine learning modeling capability to support global marketing programs. In collaboration with a multidisciplinary team of Marketing, Product Management, Data Scientists, and Engineers, you will tap into the underlying data, develop and align on key metrics/methodologies, and generate insights that enable marketers to develop powerful, highly effective marketing programs.

You will leverage core Data Science expertise to design, prototype, and build out analysis pipelines to support initiatives and Marketing campaigns at scale. You'll perform analytics, design and execute on experimentation, and conduct incremental measurement analysis to inform strategic decisions of the marketing programs across the entire Ads Marketing space, from acquisition, onboarding, growth, and retention.

You will build analytical frameworks and measurement capabilities to generate data driven insights that drive business growth. You will present and communicate effectively to marketing partners and leadership, data-driven insights and analytic results to inform on decision making.

Responsibilities
• Work with large, complex data sets. Solve complex analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods (e.g., statistical and machine learning models) as needed. Conduct analysis that includes problem formulation, data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
• Design and analyze controlled experiments or counterfactual causal inference studies to examine the incremental impact of Ads marketing programs.
• Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive knowledge of Google data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed.
• Interact cross-functionally, making business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
• Develop and automate reports, iteratively building and prototyping dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.

Qualifications: Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Bioinformatics, Economics, etc.) or equivalent practical experience
2 years of experience in a data science related field
Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python, MATLAB) and database languages (i.e. SQL)
Experience leveraging data insights into storytelling for business stakeholders

data.job_description:
### (Senior) Data Analyst, Blockchain

NYC or Remote / Full-Time

##### About Arkham

Arkham is a blockchain analytics startup building an intelligence platform that provides information on the real-world entities and individuals behind crypto market activity. We’re a Series A startup with over $12 million raised from investors including the founders of Palantir and OpenAI, and VCs including Geoff Lewis at Bedrock and Tim Draper. Our founders are veterans of the crypto industry, having previously founded Reserve, a stablecoin project for hyperinflationary economies, with investors including Peter Thiel, Sam Altman, Coinbase, and Digital Currency Group, among others.

##### Role & Responsibilities
The Data Analyst will be responsible for:

- Assisting the development of predictive models and programs that identify the entities and individuals behind specific cryptocurrency addresses and contracts
- Ensuring data quality and administering databases for the intelligence that powers the Arkham platform
- Supporting the development of predictive models providing useful labels and metadata about cryptocurrency activity
- A variety of other analysis and supporting the development of the Arkham platform

##### Who You Are
- Proven track record and experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist
- Proficient with relational databases, statistics, analytics and visualization tools (e.g. SQL, Excel, Python, R)
- Familiarity with the blockchain ecosystem and a strong passion to learn more (crypto fluency)
- An investigative mindset, eager to learn and utilize all available resources to get the job done
- Self-starter and able to operate independently while maintaining a focus on delivery and excellence at work
- Comfortable with wearing multiple hats, navigating ambiguity and adapting to changes in priorities and plans

##### What We Value

We are a tight-knit team with ambitious plans, looking for people to work closely with as we expand in the coming years. We have a strong company culture that values camaraderie, righteousness, loyalty, and judicious decision-making. We give team members the autonomy to make decisions on the basis of the special knowledge they’ve developed, without being hampered by rules and bureaucracy. This makes for an environment where competent people can get things done in novel situations with minimal guidance.

##### Compensation

We are committed to hiring elite talent, and that is reflected in our salary and equity compensation with unlimited PTO.

www.arkhamintelligence.com

www.twitter.com/arkhamintel

Proficient with relational databases, statistics, analytics and visualization tools (e.g. SQL, Excel, Python, R)
Familiarity with the blockchain ecosystem and a strong passion to learn more (crypto fluency)
An investigative mindset, eager to learn and utilize all available resources to get the job done
Self-starter and able to operate independently while maintaining a focus on delivery and excellence at work
Comfortable with wearing multiple hats, navigating ambiguity and adapting to changes in priorities and plans

Assisting the development of predictive models and programs that identify the entities and individuals behind specific cryptocurrency addresses and contracts
Ensuring data quality and administering databases for the intelligence that powers the Arkham platform
Supporting the development of predictive models providing useful labels and metadata about cryptocurrency activity
A variety of other analysis and supporting the development of the Arkham platform

Centerstone is among the nation's leading nonprofit behavioral health systems with thousands of employees dedicated to delivering care that changes people's lives. A dynamic, well-established organization, we offer rewarding opportunities to serve all ages in a variety of settings. Come talk to us about joining the Centerstone team!

Job Description:

Clinical Data Analyst

Job summary:

The Clinical Data Analyst is an administrative position within the Florida Operations team as a part of the Quality Improvement Department. This position will also work closely with the Analytics State Reporting team. The Clinical Data Analyst provides support by thoroughly examining, entering and correcting clinical data specifically related to FASAMS, thereby improving the quality and efficiency of care by Centerstone staff. They work in such a way, Delivering care that changes people's lives, making Centerstone's Noble Purpose evident to all they serve.

Job Qualifications
• Associate's Degree or equivalent experience preferred
• Experience working with EHR/EMR systems from a billing, support, and/or user perspective
• Proficient using Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint
• Proven ability to quickly grasp information and independently produce results
• Strong positive communications skills, especially in written documentation
• Strong interest and drive to improve clinical standards and procedures
• Aptitude for building rapport across various groups

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Primary responsibilities
• Analyzes and corrects clinical data to ensure documentation is accurately entered to prevent errors
• Provides accurate, positive, and timely service to staff
• Reports documentation validity concerns to management, HIM, Compliance, Quality Improvement, and Finance as needed
• Assists with testing new EHR functionality to ensure it is ready for production site as needed
• Responsible for protecting, securing, and proper handling of all confidential data held by Centerstone to ensure against unauthorized access, improper transmission, and/or unapproved disclosure of information that could result in harm to Centerstone
• Provides assistance in special projects given around data correction within the electronic health record as needed

Regular and Reliable attendance is required.

This position will primarily be remote.

• Compliance with all documentation standards and regulations
• Maintains thorough knowledge of regulatory reporting related to FASAMS
• Timely processes Service Desk requests related to FASAMS
• Liaison between the Quality, Clinical and Technical teams
• Resolves Errors and Corrections prior to the end of the reporting month

It powers our innovation and connects us closer to each other, to our clients and the communities we serve. We strive to create a workplace that reflects the growing world around us, and where everyone feels empowered, safe and welcomed.

data.job_description:
At E15, we are the spark that ignites. Our team delivers next-generation insights based on data, not hunches, to drive business in healthcare, campus, corporate, sports, entertainment, hospitality, and retail industries to help companies make forward-looking decisions to benefit their business and their guests. For more information on what we are about as a company, check us out by following the link below: www.e15group.com

LOCATION REQUIRMENTS: Remote Nationwide

SALARY RANGE: $120k - $130k base plus annual bonus and company benefits

Job Summary

In this role, you will be the first point of contact for those leveraging E15’s internal Snowflake data warehouse for a global Fortune 5 client. You will have the opportunity to design, govern, and document the data assets leveraged by operators and internal analysts, ensuring the data is accurate, and effectively leveraged by the business. You will need to understand the business and its strategic priorities, refine requirements for tables/views, and support the ongoing delivery of our client's master data strategy. As a result, strong SQL skills are a requirement to be successful in this role. You will partner closely with other E15ers, including visualization experts, to further develop the robust analytical reporting platform by creating new models to support leadership and executive client use cases. You will report to the Senior Director of Strategy & Analytics for the account and work closely with a diverse team of leaders within our organization daily.

We ingest data from dozens of enterprise systems using AWS Glue and Airflow, then model and present the data to our end users with DBT/SQL & Snowflake. We operate under the Scrum framework leveraging ADO to track work items and priorities. As this is a high priority account with a global team, it is important to move quickly and be flexible to delivery on short-notice requests. Our data asset is currently >150TB and growing rapidly.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES
• Provide governed access to existing data assets to operators and analysts
• Work with analysts and business owners to fulfill data requests
• Oversee auditing and governance of data assets
• Support technical teams with development requirements
• Create new data tables/views based on stakeholder use cases

REQUIRED SKILLS
• 3+ years of hands-on SQL programming experience
• 3+ years of Business Analytics experience working on complex projects with senior leadership
• Clear, concise, and proactive communication skills with stakeholders

PREFERRED SKILLS
• DBT (Data Build Tool) experience
• Python programming experience
• Snowflake Data Warehouse experience
• Experience in DevOps and CI/CD technologies and methodologies
• Familiarity with core business data (SAP, P&L statements, purchasing data)
• Familiarity with visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)

Apply to E15 today!

E15 is a member of Compass Group USA

Click here to Learn More about the Compass Story

data.job_description:
At MRP we know it's crucial that our people reflect the diversity of our customers from around the world. And we know that having people from all walks of life makes us a more creative and innovative company. That variety of experience, culture and background allows our teams to truly drive innovation and create a great experience for both our people and our customers. MRP is a place where we value Diversity & Inclusion and we work really hard to be a great place to work, for everyone.

Market Resource Partners (MRP) is a global provider of strategic marketing and demand generation services for the technology industry. Founded in 2002 and headquartered in Philadelphia, MRP has expanded its reach worldwide with offices around the world. We specialize in the design and execution of B2B marketing programs, executed both on a local and global basis. To ensure the continued success and integrity of our internal database, we are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Belfast, NI or Philadelphia, PA USA. The role of the Data Analyst will be to continuously analyze and take action to improve the quality, completeness and accuracy of MRP's CRM SQL database. The successful candidate will be part of the Data Management team, working to enrich the outputs of the data team and contribute to the overall success of the business supporting and facilitating the performance of our sales teams. This is a great opportunity for someone who is interested in a career within the Data Management/Analytics space and is willing to learn in a fast-paced environment.

We are interested in a candidate who:
• Has an interest in Data Analysis, Data Cleansing/Matching, Deduplication and Visualization.
• Has an Interest in Automation Projects/ Optimizing data for performance
• Is interested in programming in Python and Web Scraping
• Is willing to work in a Hybrid mode (some days in the office, some days WFH, subject to change over time)

Job Duties
• Work with Data Manager and other stakeholders to identify gaps in CRM database quality and breadth, and continuously work to improve the overall quality of CRM data
• Prioritize and action areas for improving database quality, such as data cleansing, standardizing, normalizing, and de-duplication of data. Append additional data attributes where available to existing data within the CRM
• Work with externally sourced data lists to prepare data for importation into the CRM application
• Enrich account/contact data through sourcing missing data attributes (i.e.: revenue, employee counts, email address, etc.) where needed using data matching techniques
• Work on special database projects where needed
• Perform research on new global data sources and identify creative ways to extract new value from available data
• Work with additional external data providers to source additional data to enrich and expand our global Account and Contact database
• Import combined, enhanced and updated lists into the CRM application using ETL tools

Required Skills
• Proficient in MS Excel, along with SQL skills required. Specific SQL experience in data matching is beneficial but not essential. An interest in becoming proficient in database querying and analysis is essential.
• Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with individuals and groups both within and external to the company to achieve desired results.
• Demonstrated ability to analyze an issue/problem and make recommendations for an effective and efficient resolution.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Ability to work in a Microsoft Office environment.
• Strong computer skills related to the use of the internet and CRM Systems.
• Ability to analyze and manipulate data to meet business needs.
• Sets an example with regard to work habits, attitude and professionalism.
• Results driven, with the ability to innovate and simplify current process and practices

Qualifications and Experience
• University Degree in a technology or data related discipline.
• Demonstrable expertise with MS Excel.
• Basic SQL and databases experience
• Data matching and Merging beneficial but not essential
• Experience with ETL tools beneficial but not essential
• Python Experience beneficial but not essential
• Understanding / experience with CRM a plus.

data.job_description:
Morgan, Lewis & Bockius LLP, one of the world's leading global law firms with offices in strategic hubs of commerce, law, and government across North America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East, is seeking to hire a Senior Data Analyst for its Legal Practice Data Analytics Department. This position will be resident in any of our U.S. offices, but the ideal candidate would be generally available to work a schedule of 11:00 AM Eastern to 8:00 PM Eastern (i.e., 8:00 AM Pacific to 5:00 PM Pacific). As our world becomes more data driven, data analysts with strong technical skills are becoming absolutely essential to the practice of law. In this role, the selected candidate will be on the front line of law and data analytics.

This position can reside in either of our Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Philadelphia, Washington DC office with a hybrid in-office/remote working schedule.

Responsibilities:
• Work in a collaborative team environment to support attorneys and paralegals on a wide variety of complex business and legal issues
• Access, parse, and load complex data sets from small text files to large databases from enterprise applications quickly, efficiently, and accurately
• Perform data engineering, modeling, and analytic tasks to facilitate client reporting capabilities, enhance dashboards, and provide actionable data and insightful analysis
• Join attorneys on client meetings to lead technical discussions including output file definition, input file requirements, and general interpretation of data
• Mentor, teach, share knowledge and analytic techniques with your colleagues

Education and experience:
• Minimum of three years of relevant experience in developing analytic solutions with proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, or similar data analysis and ETL tools
• Bachelor's degree (B.S./B.A.) in an appropriate field from an accredited college or university
• Preferred experience in developing client facing visualizations and reports using Power BI, SSRS or similar visualization tools is a plus
• Preferred knowledge of coding in Python, R, DAX and/or M
• Preferred experience in developing SSIS and/or SSAS solutions
• Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey highly complex technical concepts down to actionable objectives to advise stakeholders including attorneys, firm management, and firm colleagues
• Experience in project management including planning, organizing, and supervising clients and colleagues towards successful project completion
• Demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment
• Expert level of proficiency with T-SQL or equivalent including a high level of proficiency in database administration
• High proficiency with Microsoft Excel including an ability to create pivot tables, power pivots & queries, formulas, and external data connections
• Ability to design and implement ETL solutions

#LI-TS

data.job_description:
Overview

In the Economics and Damages practice for BRG, we advise and provide our clients with analyses for expert testimony in antitrust, class action, damages analysis, data analytics, false advertising, intellectual property, commercial litigation, and public policy matters. Led by experts in their disciplines, our teams have conducted a wide range of complex quantitative and qualitative analyses that have been presented in federal and state courts; before national and international arbitration panels; and before the Department of Justice, Federal Trade Commission, and Federal Communications Commission, among others.

The Senior Associate and Consultant positions are staff positions. Both positions require a highly motivated problem solver with strong data analytical ability and a desire to advance within the organization by furthering analytical skills and project management responsibilities. The work of a Senior Associate or Consultant can be either qualitative or quantitative in nature. Projects can range from industry and subject-matter research to data collection to the preparation of statistical, financial, and other forms of analysis.

Job Responsibilities:
• Develop and maintain electronic databases, spreadsheets and other files as dictated by project needs.
• Perform detailed research and analysis, then put the results into action (e.g., gather, review, and summarize literature and data from the public domain, specialized industry resources, or client, public and commercial databases).
• Demonstrate creativity and efficient use of relevant software tools, analytical methods, and computer models to develop solutions.
• Audit own work product and work product of others to assure quality.
• Participate in a team environment and work hard to meet client deadlines and quality expectations.
• Demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills.
• Participate in group practice meetings and travel as needed.

Basic Qualifications:
• A Bachelor’s degree in the area of economics, statistics, analytics or a relevant field;
• Minimum one (1) year of work experience in data analysis;
• Strong oral and written communication skills both internally and externally with clients;
• Working knowledge of statistical software or programming language such as SAS/ Stata/R. Will consider those that have experience with SQL/Python and open to learning additional languages;
• A desire to expand those capabilities is expected; and
• Proficiency with Microsoft Excel.

Additional Qualifications:
• Master’s or MBA in Business, Economics, Statistics; and/or related degree is a plus;
• Minimum one (1) year of work experience as a consultant in the industry; and/or
• Experience working in econometrics or statistics.

ABOUT BRG

Berkeley Research Group provides independent advice, data analytics, authoritative studies, expert testimony, investigations, and regulatory and dispute consulting to Fortune 500 corporations, financial institutions, government agencies, major law firms, and regulatory bodies around the world. BRG experts provide sophisticated economic, financial, and analytical advice across a wide range of disciplines, including antitrust and competition policy, complex damages, finance, healthcare, intellectual property, restructuring, valuation, and workforce issues. In addition, the firm assists clients in major industry sectors with compliance, business process improvement, and strategy consulting.

Candidate must be able to submit verification of his/her legal right to work in the United States, without company sponsorship.

Description:

Job Title - Retail Real Estate Strategy Analyst

Job Description: Responsible for providing analysis support and compiles key data for analysis for strategic long-range planning and placement for all Xfinity stores. Proactively manages data utilizing Comcast specific database in Smartsheet and mapping and modeling tools.

Maintains and gathers information for portfolio data management and contract administration. Prepares materials for and participates in Division and Region planning and update meetings.

Core Responsibilities:

• Utilizes Mastercard Predictive Modeling tool to run a model to accurately predict store performance

• Works with RES Esri based to model and map the proper placement for stores based on homes passed actives drive times and demographics

• Partners with Finance to provide information to request an ROI for all new stores

• Compiles data from the PL utilizing VLOOKUP and pivot table functions in Excel to create reports used in Real Estate Long Range Planning

• Assist with ad hoc initiatives related to store planning distribution and optimization

• Create monthly and quarterly Division and Region views of store metrics and profitability

• Conducts research on micro and macro factors impacting the retail real estate industry

• Other duties and responsibilities as assigned associated with the Retail strategy and portfolio optimization.

• Strong skills in Smartsheet

• Experience conducting retail store analytics and strategy for optimal distribution of stores

• Retail real estate experience

• Strong strategic thinking capabilities

• Understands both internal and external customer needs and identifies solutions

Expert Level

TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

Description:

World-Class Clinical Coding

More than a job, we're offering the ultimate opportunity for clinical coding professionals. There's never been a better time to join our team. A recent conversion to EMR across all five campuses is taking health information management to exciting heights.

Junior Analyst Medical Data ( Coder ) – Emergency Department

In this role the Junior Medical Data Analyst performs diagnostic and procedural coding for Emergency Department medical records. Utilizing medical records, you’ll review, abstract and apply appropriate diagnostic coding, facility level E&M coding, and APC assignment of Emergency Department patient records according to coding guidelines as applicable. You will review Emergency Department medical records to interpret documentation and assigns accurate coding for procedures in accordance with guidelines established within the Emergency Department. You will communicate with physicians appropriate to clarify documentation as related to APC or coding assignment. You will prepare abstract information in accordance with mandated hospital, state, and federal registry programs. Corrects and resubmits data from abstracts as identified through edit reports from said registries.

This is a Full time day position, (Tuesday - Saturday or Sunday to Thursday, 9:00 am to 5:00 pm shift, weekend hybrid position which will be located at our corporate office in Midtown Manhattan.

Preferred Criteria
• CCS, RHIA or RHIT

Required Criteria
• College level courses or equivalent in anatomy and physiology, and medical terminology
• One year demonstrated ED diagnostic and procedural coding experience preferably in a computerized/electronic environment in an academic medical center
• Provide evidence of successfully completed coding course in ICD-10CM, CPT4, HCPCS, E&M and applicable grouper coding schemes
• Pass a skills assessment consisting of a representative sample of ED services at NYPH for all promotion/hires

#LI-JR1

Join a healthcare system where employee engagement is at an all-time high. Here we foster a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusion. Enjoy comprehensive and competitive benefits that support you and your family in every aspect of life. Start your life-changing journey today.
__________________
• 2021 "Employees' Choice Awards: Best Places to Work" - Glassdoor
• 2021 " Best Workplaces in Health Care & Biopharma" - Fortune
• 2020 "America's Best Employers in New York State" - Forbes
• 2020 "Working Mother 100 Best Companies" - Working Mother
• 2020 "Best Companies for Multicultural Women" - Working Mother
• 2020 "Best Workplace for Men in Nursing" - American Association for Men in Nursing
• Discover why at: nyp.org/careers

NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital is an equal opportunity employer.

Salary Range:

$34.46-$43.47/Hourly

It all begins with you. Our amazing compensation packages start with competitive base pay and include recognition for your experience, education, and licensure. Then we add our amazing benefits, countless opportunities for personal and professional growth and a dynamic environment that embraces every person. Join our team and discover where amazing works.

data.job_description:
The Opportunity

Springboard runs an online Data Analytics Career Track Bootcamp in which participants learn with the help of a case-study-based curriculum and 1-1 guidance from an expert mentor.

Springboard has recently established some exciting partnerships that are set to kick off in the beginning of 2023 like our most recent partnerships with Amazon and Walmart! These partnerships are available for upskilling and reskilling, and offer customized, company-specific projects to provide employees with the most up-to-date skill sets to drive business impact through contextualized and company-specific learning.

We are looking for individuals that are passionate about mentoring as you are about Data Analytics, and can give a few hours per week in return for an honorarium, we would love to hear from you.

Questions? Please write to us at mentorrecruiting@springboard.com

The Programs:
• Completely online
• ~8 month course that takes students through real-world business cases
• Students learn about Data Analytics with the help of an online curriculum and a personal mentor
• Students go through the curriculum on their own
• Students have a weekly 30-minute video call with their mentor to discuss questions, projects, and career advice!
• Students communicate with mentors outside of calls on an as-needed basis to support learning and career objectives
• We have standard Springboard courses as well as partnerships with various businesses and universities that our mentors support

You:
• Are as passionate about teaching Data Analytics as about Data Analytics itself
• Are proficient in the topics covered in our curriculum, including Excel, SQL, Tableau and Python
• Have an excellent understanding of data visualization, data storytelling, and how to think about data problems in a business context
• Are available for weekly, 30-minute video check-ins for each student to help them set and achieve learning goals, provide feedback, and help them move towards getting a job
• Are able to utilize Zoom for the 30-minute calls with students
• Are available outside of weekly calls for each student to review projects and answer questions as needed
• Have at least 3 years of experience solving real-life business and data analytics problems, and are comfortable working with large data sets
• Are empathetic and have excellent communication skills
• *Must be willing to start in early 2023**

Benefits:
• Membership in a rich community of expert mentors from great companies like Capital One, Lyft, McKinsey, and Square
• Change the lives of students in our programs
• Help us revolutionize online education!
• Data Analytics mentors are paid an honorarium between $15.00-$27.50 per 30 minute call with students
• Work at your convenience

Are proficient in the topics covered in our curriculum, including Excel, SQL, Tableau and Python
Have an excellent understanding of data visualization, data storytelling, and how to think about data problems in a business context
Are available for weekly, 30-minute video check-ins for each student to help them set and achieve learning goals, provide feedback, and help them move towards getting a job
Are available outside of weekly calls for each student to review projects and answer questions as needed
Have at least 3 years of experience solving real-life business and data analytics problems, and are comfortable working with large data sets
Are empathetic and have excellent communication skills

Title: Senior Engineer (Data Analyst) - 1570

Location : Remote

Duration : 12 months (Longterm contract)

Job Description:
• Communicate and understand business goals and requirements, and work to create data solutions that add value to the business.
• Support technical and product managers to ensure that all aspects of the information analysis and requirements gathering process are completed with the highest degree of accuracy and quality, including the development and socialization of key project artifacts.
• Develop and participate in the review of requirements, data mappings, use cases and other artifacts and clearly communicate to both the business and technical team members the system requirements.
• Demonstrate the ability to access data, analyze data, and remediate data issues leveraging SQL and applicable AWS analytics tools such as Athena.
• Support team with functional, regression and end to end testing efforts ensuring that features deliver the expected functionality with high quality.
• Create and maintain functional and system tests to replicate complex real-world scenarios.
• Support ad hoc data requests as required as part of DevOps team.

Responsibilities:
• A minimum of 5-7 years’ experience in software development, data management and applying knowledge, skills, tools and techniques to a broad range of life-cycle activities in order to meet the requirements for data projects and process improvement initiatives to include agile development process; cloud and microservices analysis, architecture and design; functional and regression testing; and software configuration.
• Demonstrated experience with AWS Lambda, Node JS, SNS/SQS, S3, IAM, CloudWatch, RDS, DynamoDB, and Athena.
• Related Skills & Other Requirements
• Strong ability to explain advanced data concepts to both database developers and architects, non-technical end users, and senior executives.
• Experience with cloud technologies especially AWS serverless development tools and architecture.
• Working experience with CI/CD and DevOps
• Comfortable with building, deploying, and maintaining web applications in AWS environment (Lambda, DynamoDB and SQS/SNS).
• Experience in developing requirements for business intelligence, master data management and functional-data projects.
• Ability to understand business needs and translate them into technical specifications.
• Experience with Oracle Database and expertise in understanding and writing SQL.
• Demonstrate a strong attention to detail, high degree of initiative, and excellent documentation and communication skills.
• Proficiency with Jira and Wiki.

data.job_description:
Position: Data Analyst, Business Analytics (Remote)
Job Description

Performs disciplined and detailed reporting and analysis of customer data that enables corporate growth, engagement and retention of diverse customer base across all formats. Provides fact-based data-driven insights on customer behavior and lifetime values that directs change in the business and drives incremental revenue. Executes concise and actionable business reporting with customer insights. Works with team members and business partners to define requirements for analysis to implement more profitable "best practices."

Responsibilities /Skills/Experience

Requirements

JOB DUTIES/

RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Gathers data, applies analytic methods, and synthesizes conclusions into recommendations and presents findings to managers and business partners.

• Anticipates additional questions based on the findings and ensures data set is constructed to answer those questions.

• Develops, maintains, and enhances reporting and analysis processes to help generate profitable incremental sales in marketing.

• Prepares documentation for developed analysis to support business strategies.

• Serves as a team leader for automation, stream-lined processes, and technical "best practices."

• Works with offshore resources to implement automated and frequent ad hoc requests. Identifies and communicates data inconsistencies.

• Takes initiative to determine root cause and makes recommendations for resolution.

• Utilizes analytics to provide business recommendations to management and advises business partners.

• Constructs experimental designs to answer business questions.

• Creates business financial models or test plans as needed to enable businesses to understand the value of specific promotional tactics.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

• Master's degree in Business Administration, Data Science or a related field (willing to accept foreign education equivalent) plus 3 years of experience performing business analysis based on data, modeling, and forecasting to support strategic decision-making within the service and e-commerce domain.

• Alternatively, a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Data Science or a related field (willing to accept foreign education equivalent) and 5 years of experience performing business analysis based on data, modeling, and forecasting to support strategic decision-making within the service and e-commerce domain.

• Must also possess the following skills:
- (1) Demonstrated Expertise (DE) performing business analytics and data management within the service industry using SQL (Teradata, MySQL, Snowflake, DBeaver) to produce concise conclusions from raw data and drive solutions according to business requirements;
- (2) DE performing data modeling, prediction and optimization to improve business metrics by utilizing Agile process including SCRUM, JIRA project management, programming software and languages, including Python, R, SQL, and Excel;
- (3) DE publishing reporting and analytics utilizing reporting software including SAP Business Objects & Web Intelligence, Microstrategy, Tableau and Excel to aid business decisions and drive profits;
- (4) DE performing regression analysis, optimization techniques and simulation models to run various business scenarios and analyze different outcomes, and Monte Carlo simulations to account for and manage uncertainty in business decision-making; and,
- (5) DE performing data mining and predictive modeling using R programming and related algorithms and technologies to deliver business insights and recommendations.

Qualifications: Master's degree in Business Administration, Data Science or a related field (willing to accept foreign education equivalent) plus 3 years of experience performing business analysis based on data, modeling, and forecasting to support strategic decision-making within the service and e-commerce domain
Must also possess the following skills:

(1) Demonstrated Expertise (DE) performing business analytics and data management within the service industry using SQL (Teradata, MySQL, Snowflake, DBeaver) to produce concise conclusions from raw data and drive solutions according to business requirements;

(2) DE performing data modeling, prediction and optimization to improve business metrics by utilizing Agile process including SCRUM, JIRA project management, programming software and languages, including Python, R, SQL, and Excel;
(3) DE publishing reporting and analytics utilizing reporting software including SAP Business Objects & Web Intelligence, Microstrategy, Tableau and Excel to aid business decisions and drive profits;
(5) DE performing data mining and predictive modeling using R programming and related algorithms and technologies to deliver business insights and recommendations

Provides fact-based data-driven insights on customer behavior and lifetime values that directs change in the business and drives incremental revenue
Executes concise and actionable business reporting with customer insights

Job Description:

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

• Interact with various departments including, but not limited to, IT; Finance; Claims, Call Centers; and UM.
• Manages team of Data Analysts and Technical Analyst onsite and offsite.
• Provides day-to-day technical management and mentoring as required of the department staff.

• Coordinate and oversee report generation by team members and distribution schedule to ensure timely delivery to customers, ensuring the highest quality on every project/request. Responsible for error resolution, follow up and performance metrics monitoring.

• Provide peer review of critical reports and guidance on programming / logic improvements; provide guidance to team members in their analysis of data sets and trends using statistical tools and techniques to determine significance and relevance.

• Participate in and guide the design of large scale predictive and statistical models to predict future trends in cost, utilization and performance. Guide team members on appropriate writing skills for executive summaries tailored to the audience.

• Apply process improvements for the team's methods of collecting and documenting report / programming requirements from requestors to ensure appropriate creation of reports and analyses while reducing rework.

• Manage the creation of comprehensive workflows for the production and distribution of assigned reports; document reporting processes and procedures.

• Ensure Development, implementation and use of software and systems to support the department's goals.

• Lead efforts to create new databases and reporting tools for monitoring, tracking and trending based on project specifications.

• Build / Review data models for data analytics.

• Oversee development of ad-hoc and standard reports using Microsoft Power BI, Tableu, MS SQL, Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Medinsight, RxNavigator, data analytics on the Hadoop platform, ATScale, SSAS, PowerBI Cloud and other analytic / programming tools.

• Analyze and manipulate large dataset in Big Data environment using tools such as Scala, py/Spark, SQL Server Integration Service (SSIS), and Impala.

• Create comprehensive workflows for the production and distribution of assigned reports; document reporting processes and procedures.

• Assist with research, development and completion of special projects as requested by various internal departments, or in support of requests from regulatory agencies, contracting agencies, or other external organizations.

• Maintain SharePoint Sites as needed, including training materials and documentation archives.

Job Summary

The Director, Data Analytics & Business Intelligence will lead the Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team developing the vision and resources for data-driven strategic financial analytics projects utilizing mathematics, statistics, engineering, and/or operational research to solve business problems and make better business decisions. This role supports financial forecasting, optimization, simulation, data mining, experimental designs, and causal and sensitivity relationship identification. This position supervises and/or coordinates cross-functional teams of Finance, Marketing, Engineering, Operations, Human Resources, IT, external consultants, and other resources, as applicable, for the projects. The ideal candidate will prepare and present strategic insights, recommendations, proposals, and business cases to influence key internal stakeholders and Senior Leadership.

Responsibilities
• Develops data mining and advanced analytics strategies
• Oversees tool development and metrics availability
• Develops and manages project roadmaps
• Serves as internal project lead
• Provides ad hoc project support
• Leads and develops others

Preferences
• Possesses experience designing and building advanced financial data models
• Demonstrates strong communication skills, including authoring and delivering presentations to multiple levels of management
• Demonstrates fundamental understanding of activity based costing methodologies
• Experience identifying and gathering Business Requirements
• Experience developing and managing project roadmaps
• Experience executing statistical models
• Experience influencing people and teams at all levels in an organization
• Bachelor’s Degree (or internationally comparable degree) in Mathematics, Business, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
• Postgraduate degree (or internationally comparable degree) in similarly applicable fields of study
• Experience developing complex Structured Query Language (SQL) queries
• Experience creating data visualization and dashboards using Power BI
• Experience programming using Python
• Experience with Google Cloud Platform
• Experience with applying machine learning with financial and/or operational scenarios

data.job_description:
Introduction
At SHRM, we are committed to making work, workers and workplaces better through insights-driven policy solutions, learning and development, thought leadership and research. We are shaping the ways employers and employees thrive together. SHRM is empowering our more than 300,000+ members, including HR professionals, business executives, and people managers, to lead as strategic business partners and effective stewards of workplace culture, business productivity, and employee engagement.

Overview

The Business Intelligence Analyst offers intelligence and insight to support SHRM's marketing and other divisions. This position is responsible for thoroughly understanding the organization's data infrastructure, attribution modeling processes, and business needs to help translate complex marketing data into actionable insights.

Work Environment:

Work is regularly performed in a professional office environment and routinely uses standard office equipment. Travel Required: Occasional 0-10%.

Responsibilities
• Develop and maintain the marketing attribution framework and inform marketing media mix decisions.
• Analyze large data sets from multiple sources to identify trends, root causes, and business improvement opportunities, and visualize those findings using traditional and digital analytics tools.
• Help marketing teams Improve marketing campaign performance – especially as it relates to marketing attribution.
• Use systems like Tableau and Alteryx to produce and maintain regular dashboards and visualize data from various SHRM data sources.
• Support a fact-based culture to drive decision-making and marketing investments.
• Support business units in understanding and validating results; help tell the data story by extracting actionable insights from complex data.
• Support Business Intelligence data efforts through quality assurance and due diligence.
• Enhance data collection procedures to support and improve the validity of SHRM’s reporting.
• Provide ad hoc analyses for various business units.
• Other duties and projects as assigned.

Requirements

Required:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business or Marketing; or equivalent relevant work experience/training
• At least three (3) years of experience with big data analytics. Experience with data science or working on large, complex data sets preferred.
• Experience with marketing, product-based data analysis.
• Experience functioning in a highly matrixed organization.
• Experience with data analysis and visualization tools like Tableau, Alteryx and MSSQL
• Strong data analysis skills and mathematical statistical tool proficiency.
• High attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
• Professional integrity necessary to maintain confidentiality.
• Strong planning skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Excellent verbal, and written communication skills.
• Ability to complete assigned duties within critical deadlines.
• Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
• Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
• Proficiency with modern reporting platforms and tools like Tableau and Alteryx.
• Ability to grasp complex platform concepts and business models, in a digital context.

Preferred:
• Notable accomplishments in data storytelling & customer demographics data.
• Exposure to Google cloud and big query
• Exposure to predictive analytics.
• Ability to derive and present compelling stories based on data and metrics.
• Ability to build professional relationships across reporting lines

Certifications:
• Tableau Desktop Certified preferred

Physical Requirements:
• Must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily with reasonable accommodations.
• Work is generally done sitting, talking, hearing and typing. Visual acuity to use a keyboard, prepare and analyze data and figures; transcribing, viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business or Marketing; or equivalent relevant work experience/training
At least three (3) years of experience with big data analytics
Must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily with reasonable accommodations

data.job_description:
The International Center for Language Studies (ICLS) is a woman-owned, independent language school based in Washington, DC, which is now celebrating 50 years of delivering high-quality training in ESL and over 85 different foreign languages. The ICLS mission is to offer student-centered language programs that develop authentic target language use, focus on individual goals, and enable students to be successful in a global environment.

ICLS is contracted by Department of State's Foreign Service Institute (FSI) to provide high quality teachers, testers, examiners, raters, curriculum developers, and other admin staff to support the School of Language Studies (SLS) at FSI. Should you be interested in joining ICLS project team at FSI, please answer the following questions to better match you for the right labor category and upload your most updated resume.

Duties:
• Provide expert advice and develop SLS-wide policies, processes, and systems for data collection and analysis.
• Engage with Divisions in the implementation of data-related policies and processes.
• Construct and maintain multiple large institutional datasets.
• Develop interactive dashboards and other reports in Tableau and/or Excel to make data readily available to stakeholders.
• Propose, design, and conduct advanced statistical analyses using large institutional datasets.
• Generate relevant findings, conclusions, and recommendations to improve SLS policy and/or program effectiveness.
• Interpret data and communicate technical information (e.g., results, recommendations) to non-technical and senior-level audiences.
• Advise Divisions in collecting, analyzing, and presenting data.
• Design and lead data analysis training activities for SLS, including developing and delivering training modules and job aids.
